message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and examination findings suggest acute angle-closure glaucoma, which is a known side effect of topiramate. None of the other options are known to cause this condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest acute angle closure glaucoma, which is a known side effect of Topiramate. Lamotrigine, Gabapentin, and Tiagabine are not known to cause this side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and findings suggest acute angle-closure glaucoma, which can be caused by medications that have anticholinergic effects. Among the options, only Topiramate has this effect as a known side effect.
